channel.title: How can i remove ubuntu
channel.description:
I accidentally installed ubuntu on my windows hard drive, at least I think...Im pretty new at this, just trying to get an idea of what its all about. Anyway, if not remove it at least get it out of the boot loader thingy, cause thats a bitch to select XP every time. I dont want to delete the partition either, i just spent about 5 hours downloading shit onto my new comp
On a side note, mabey someone could give me a little help? With the loader thingy if you select "HD1" as the boot, does that imply it will only have the option to boot when hard drive 2 is boot prioritised.
Sorry if its confusing, i'm at lack of better experience and understanding. And dont say "Linux isnt for you nob" I just want to see what its all about.

item.title: How can i remove ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

on your linux partition open /boot/grub/menu.lst
swap the windows xp section part with the linux ones.

title		Microsoft Windows XP Home Edition
root		(hd0,0)
savedefault
makeactive
chainloader	+1
# This is a divider, added to separate the menu items below from the Debian
# ones.
title		Other operating systems:
root
title		Ubuntu, kernel 2.6.15-23-386
root		(hd0,2)
kernel		/boot/vmlinuz-2.6.15-23-386 root=/dev/hda3 ro quiet splash
initrd		/boot/initrd.img-2.6.15-23-386
#savedefault
boot
title		Ubuntu, kernel 2.6.15-23-386 (recovery mode)
root		(hd0,2)
kernel		/boot/vmlinuz-2.6.15-23-386 root=/dev/hda3 ro single
initrd		/boot/initrd.img-2.6.15-23-386
boot
title		Ubuntu, memtest86+
root		(hd0,2)
kernel		/boot/memtest86+.bin 
boot

thats what that section of mine looks like after i have swapped it, it wotn be the same for you however, small details will change.

Read full topic
